name: East Yorkshire Round Robin (Hull-Scarborough-York-Hull)
description:
EAST YORKSHIRE ROUND ROBIN Unlimited travel with weekday time restrictions for one day from anywhere on the circular route between York-Scarborough-Bridlington-Hull-Selby-York. 
      Note that "Round Robin" tickets have the same validity as rangers, they offer unlimited travel in the area defined, you do not have to travel in a circle.

fares_and_restrictions.raw: fares & restrictions New fares from 2nd Mar 2025 One day ranger adult: £32.60 child (5-15): £16.30 16-17 saver: £16.30 railcards ⯆ 16 26 SE DI 2T FF H V : £21.70 FF H V child fare: £6.15 Railcards ⯈ Railcards: 16 = 16-25 26 = 26-30 SE = Senior DI = Disabled 2T = Two Together FF = Family & Friends H = HM Forces V = Veterans Previous fares ⯈ Previous fares (adult): 2024 - £31.20 2023 - £29.70 2022 - £28.00 2021 - £26.30 2020 - £26.30 2019 - £25.50 2018 - £24.80 2014 - £23.00 2011 - £20.00 time restrictions Mon to Fri: valid from 09:00 but 2T railcard not valid until 09:30 No restrictions at weekends or bank holidays train operating companies London North Eastern Railway, Northern, TransPennine Express purchasing Online: X Train conductor: ✔ * Station ticket office: ✔ Ticket Vending Machine: i Northern Ticket Vending Machines now sell most ranger and rover tickets but at the moment only for same-day travel (rather prohibitive for distant areas) Some Avanti West Coast station TVMs for example Crewe, now sell local rangers and rovers. LNER TVMs at Doncaster, Edinburgh, London King's Cross, Newcastle and York also sell them. A number of PTE areas sell local rangers from TVMs in their area e.g. South Yorkshire, Strathclyde and West Midlands * valid ticket to travel is required unless boarded at a station without ticket-issuing facilities
